title: Cardi B appears to confirm Stefon Diggs split at L.A. concert
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Cardi B indicated a split from Stefon Diggs at an L.A. concert while discussing her relationship status.
Breakup rumors emerged after Diggs and Cardi B unfollowed each other on Instagram post-Super Bowl loss.
Stefon Diggs faces legal issues with battery and strangulation charges, with a pre-trial hearing set for April 1.

title: UMass ordered to lift suspension for student who organized pro-Palestinian protest
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: A judge ruled UMass Amherst likely violated a student's First Amendment rights by suspending him for organizing a protest.
Junior Kivlighan de Montebello was suspended after a protest against RTX during a career fair at UMass in September 2025.
Justice Jeffrey Trapani ordered UMass to lift Montebello's suspension and barred further disciplinary actions while the case is ongoing.

title: Hanover police officer charged with motor vehicle homicide in fatal Brockton hit-and-run
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Hanover officer Thomas Hayes charged with homicide for alleged fatal hit-and-run in Brockton.
Victim Alfredo Alves, 23, was struck near Battles and Cross Streets, pronounced dead at Boston Medical Center.
Hayes, on administrative leave, pleaded not guilty and is jailed on $15,000 bail, court date set for March 31.

title: Choosing a product that fixes foggy headlights
author: John Paul
bullets: John Paul, AAA Northeast's Car Doctor, discusses solutions for cleaning foggy headlights, recommending Meguiar's Keep Clear Headlight Coating.
Regular maintenance is advised to prevent fogged headlights, as they can block up to 90% of light, impacting safety.
AAA Northeast offers battery testing and replacement for $220 with a three-year warranty, catering to AAA members.

title: Man arrested in Fenway on child rape, human trafficking charges
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Talik Rashaun Garcia, 36, was arrested in Fenway on charges of child rape and human trafficking after a police search.
Garcia faces multiple charges including trafficking minors, child rape, and possessing child exploitation material; he pleaded not guilty.
Released on $5,000 bail, Garcia must avoid the alleged victim and cannot be alone with minors except his children.

title: Man charged with motor vehicle homicide in Pittsfield hit and run that saw victim dragged 4 miles, DA says
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: William Gross, 65, charged with motor vehicle homicide after a hit-and-run killing in Pittsfield.
Victim William Colbert, 69, was dragged four miles by Gross's vehicle last week, DA stated.
Gross arrested and charged; arraignment scheduled in Central Berkshire District Court Wednesday.

title: Mass. RMV lottery opens for 250th anniversary license plates. Hereâ€™s how to apply.
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: The Massachusetts RMV is holding a lottery for low-number MA250 commemorative plates celebrating the state's 250th anniversary.
Massachusetts residents with active vehicle registrations can apply online for free, paying only standard registration and plate fees if selected.
The lottery offers 1,000 plates, including numbers 1-999 and 1776, with winners announced in early May 2026.

title: Massachusetts becomes first state to use ChatGPT in the executive branch, drawing criticism
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Massachusetts is first state to implement ChatGPT across executive branch, with phased integration starting with technology services staff.
Governor Maura Healey aims for improved government efficiency using AI while ensuring data security and non-public model training.
National Association of Government Employees criticizes the initiative, fearing job reductions and expressing skepticism about AI deployment.

title: Close to 100 jobs lost as 2 Massachusetts packaging plants shut down
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Garlock Flexibles to close Gardner, MA plants, laying off 91 employees by end of September.
Astara Capital Partners, owner since 2021, did not comment on Garlock Flexibles' future in Massachusetts.
Garlock Flexibles provides food packaging and underwent rebranding in 2023 to honor founder, Pete Garlock.

title: Assailant in Pawtucket hockey rink shooting killed ex-wife and son, police confirm
author: Abby Patkin and Molly Farrar
bullets: Robert Dorgan killed his ex-wife, Rhonda Dorgan, and son, Aidan Dorgan, during a shooting at a Pawtucket hockey rink.
Three others, including Rhonda Dorgan's parents and a family friend, were wounded and remain in critical condition.
The shooter, Robert Dorgan, died by suicide at the scene; motives remain under investigation by local police.
